definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
collectivization of agriculture (disastrous policy of communist Russia around 1930 and China in the 1950s)

sentences.english: We've laid away some electric motors for this people's commune.
sentences.chinese: 我們已經爲這個人民公社保留起幾臺電動機了。

sentences.english: The other is the forming of the city people's com-munes.
sentences.chinese: 另一項是組織了城市人民公社。

sentences.english: All these houses belong to the people's commune.
sentences.chinese: 這些房子都是屬於人民公社的。

sentences.english: We organized this people's commune in 1958.
sentences.chinese: 我們在1958年成了這個人民公社。

sentences.english: The ownership of township collective land directly derives from the ownership of the people' s communes.
sentences.chinese: 鄉鎮集體土地所有權直接源於過去的人民公社所有權。

definition: collectivization of agriculture (disastrous policy of communist Russia around 1930 and China in the 1950s)

pinyin: nong2 ye4 sheng1 chan3 he2 zuo4 she4

definition: fixing of farm output quotas for each household
land reform/same as 土地改革[tu3 di4 gai3 ge2]
after liberation (i.e. after the Communist's victory)/after the establishment of PRC in 1949
the Four Cleanups Movement (1963-66), which aimed to cleanse the politics, economy, organization and ideology of the Communist Party
school for cadres/May 7 Cadre School 五七幹校|五七干校
May 7 Cadre School (forcing educated people into re-education and peasant labor during Cultural Revolution)/abbr. for 五七幹部學校|五七干部学校[wu3 qi1 gan4 bu4 xue2 xiao4]
Cultural Revolution (1966-76)/abbr. for 文化大革命[Wen2 hua4 Da4 ge2 ming4]
